title: Preseason Healthbar Update v2
body:
Hey folks, we're back on PBE with another iteration on the updated healthbars and we need your feedback on the changes. The theme of this iteration is Familiar Plus Goodies.

**Changes are as follows:**
- Champ meters are now the same width as live and just a bit taller.
- Champ meter colors should be much closer to live values.
- Normal damage hangs around a tiny bit longer - similar to live.
- New spell shield border.
- All borders should look cleaner.
- Themed secondary resources like Corki, Jhin, etc still need a bunch of polish - feedback is still valid, but we are aware of their stylistic issues.
- Kled is fixed.
- Grey health should be much clearer.
- Burst damage is brighter on the left and darker on the right hand side to make current health more visible at all times.
- Extra life and unkillable icons got tweaks.
- Shred and defense up icons and systems have been simplified.
- Mana missing bug fixed (related to the manaflow band rune).
- CC text now has a text gradient.
- Level numbers should be centered (hopefully the fix sticks this time).

**Upcoming:**
- Resource polish (as mentioned above).
- Tower death and Nexus animations.
- Level number colors.

**New Burst**
https://i.imgur.com/nGo0GhH.gif

**Live Burst**
https://i.imgur.com/LHjGoRv.gif

replies.body: Tbh I don't see the issue with leaving them as they were with some slight tweaks, it looks like I'm playing Mobile Legends with the way the new health bars look, and I feel like seeing the health bar go solid red for one shots is WAY more satisfying than seeing some orange/yellow color like it is getting changed to
I disagree, these Health bars look much more polished than the current ones, and a Solid Color is uglier to look at plus it blends in with the Red HP the Enemies have.
Yeah I don't see how red on red is clearer or more satisfying.
What's mobile-looking about this iteration?

> [{quoted}](name=Slay Z,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=mkJ0zE5m,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2017-11-06T23:21:56.126+0000)
> 
> it looks drawn-out and click-baity rather than natural and subtle.

If by 'click-baity' you mean "attention grabbing" then I would say that they're accomplishing the exact goal that was set out by this update. Burst damage should _not_ be subtle.

Everyone keeps throwing out this criticism of it looking too much like mobile game UI design, but I would argue it's more in the direction of Arcade-esque (ala Street Fighter etc, but that's likely where mobile games get their inspiration). I think this is the right approach. We want our combat to feel epic and visceral and the UI can go a long way making that happen.

Ultimately I think most people's issue here is the timing/shake animation that happens. Personally I like the idea but maybe the timing could to tuned a bit to find a middle ground.
Holy crap you're right it's definitely the shake. That turned off and the timing of the new animation slowed down JUST a hair I think I'd actually like the new coloration.

Its not about the looks, its about the feel... imo by just removing the shaking effect (which gives that anime feel) people would stop complaining, and it would feel a lot less confusing. That's it :)
it looks like you are lagging out and the new ones are hurting my eyes they are hard to look at
Can there be an option to put the enemy's level on the right side like it is on live?

TBH in testing, no one noticed the difference - the bright red sufficiently differentiates enemy from others. From a benefit side, it's way easier to develop in and maintain a single border shape especially when you start adding animations.

>
> TBH in testing, no one noticed the difference - the bright red sufficiently differentiates enemy from others. From a benefit side, it's way easier to develop in and maintain a single border shape especially when you start adding animations.

Please give us more Colorblind options for the health bar, the current one doesn't suit everyone. 

Example: Tritanopia should have a [light pink](https://i.imgur.com/UhJfswc.png) health bar and Deuteranopia should have a [magenta](https://i.imgur.com/1DKrOnE.png) kind of tone.
{{sticker:sg-soraka}}

Give me actual examples, please. We've tested colors with multiple CB types.

Edit: I see your examples now. What I'd like to know is if the current colors are hard to for those folks to see rather than what we think they should be.

The feedback is that the transition from red to orange looks like i'm playing some mobile game that is trying to catch my eye and show off how fancy it is. It's a damn health bar we don't need some fancy damage burst. The red on red looks so much better. I will be sad if this "New Burst" stays.
its actually the opposite dude. you need to see the burst and the healt bar.

>
> TBH in testing, no one noticed the difference - the bright red sufficiently differentiates enemy from others. From a benefit side, it's way easier to develop in and maintain a single border shape especially when you start adding animations.

i really dont like the shake on the health bar.  the color for me is w/e take it or leave it, but the shake i find unnecessary and in team fights with so much shit going on it's gonna to be too cluttered to see what's going on.  at the least have an option to turn the wobble off if people find it too annoying or disorientating.  Less wobble would probably make the color a lot nicer to look at.
I really really dislike the shake on the new chunk animation, it feels like unnecessary visual clutter for something that should be readable as quickly as possible.

I'm not a fan of the wobbling health bars. With all the moving particles in a team fight already, I feel like it's too much. I think that's also a large part of the 'mobile' complaint you're getting.
Any chance we can toggle the health bar wobble?
Logging in just to comment. Live Burst looks WAAAYY better then New Burst. Its a damn health bar it doesn't need some fancy ass transition from red to orange. The red on red looks way way better.

to be fair if level square was a circle shaped and on other side from health bar that were current experience little bar (like it was couple seasons ago)  and enemy level on bar was on the right it would be 10/10 perfect health bar and every one would cheer for that human who would bring back old experience bar 
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
Post launch we're looking at signifying your teammate is about to level up without needing a full meter.
Is there any reason why the lost health doesn't start depleting immediately, compared to live which starts to go down as soon as the damage is taken?
For dramatic effect. Totally tuneable though.
I prefer the delay, it makes it more clear exactly how much damage was dealt.
I agree with Ashen that the delay makes it more clear how much damage is delt and feels smoother, im also not a fan of the shake

I assume we're going to be getting a few more screenshots here? Specifically interested in the new Defense/Shred icons, as well as the Extra Life/Unkillable icons, since those were my biggest pain points with the first iteration that we saw. :)

New burst is gorgeous though, and I think the adjusted healthbar design is fantastic.
Thanks! We tried to address the feedback we heard last week to find a happy medium. I can get some screens in, but yes, we updated those icons.
Its More arcadey and I like it. Ever think about giving the numbers that same kind of polish?
I like the new style. However something I can still not get used to is the shaking effect. It just makes it look.. weird to me.

I personally love this change but I have one problem that I know others share my opinion with. The shake on burst damage seems odd and uneeded, especially when the point of the update is to clear confusion on health bars and make things more smooth. I'd personally be much more confused with 7 shaking health bars in a team fight when there is a riven diving a back line or a fed jhin or vayne autoing things. I think this update would be phenomenal without the shake.
Looks like teemo could use a little help there, time to buff him!
Good call, lemme just tweak a few numbers here.
Any chance for some sort of thing for After-Death champs? (Sion, Karthus, Kog'maw) to show how long their After-Death Passive lasts? Just curious :P

We thought about Zombie timers and it's something we could revisit later. It's really only Karthus and Kog that would benefit as Sion already has a timer of sorts with his health constantly depleting. Kog for sure could use it.
It does hurt my eyes a little when it flashes orange. Can there be an option to use the old one?

Can you guys please the current ammo system? The new one proposed looks like a downgrade to be completely honest, and its just kinda hanging around. On the current ammo system it feels really nice to finally reach that final big red bullet that clearly shows its gonna do some damage, whilst the new one just feels bland and out of place.
What should we do with graves, xayah, and ryze then? We've got 2 systems currently.

> [{quoted}](name=Rayven,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=mkJ0zE5m,comment-id=00100000,timestamp=2017-11-06T23:37:40.955+0000)
>
> What should we do with graves, xayah, and ryze then? We've got 2 systems currently.

Mocked up a few -- my problem with the new ones is that the attempt at thematic icons gets hard to read, so I tried one with simple shapes that are VAGUELY thematic in a few places (Xayah's minor shape difference, for example). Goal was to get something easy to read at a glance.

It's obviously a super rough mock-up, and the colors would need to pop a bit more on the blue in particular, but I think something like this might work well.

https://imgur.com/GpagDz6

In order --

LEFT -- Corki. Red would represent the Big One, although I haven't parsed out whether or not it would simply change the color of ALL of  them or simply indicate which on the Big One is.

RIGHT -- From top down, we have Jhin, Xayah, Ryze, Graves.

Too simplistic? It's definitely readable without occupying a lot of visual complexity, but I'm not sure it's an IMPROVEMENT, per se. Thoughts?

Honestly, this version feels like a downgrade for Graves in my opinion.
I like the bullets shown for his ammunition, as well as I like Xayah's feathers.
These picture add to the flair of a champion and I prefer this system over the simple version.

Is the square under the level number is always gonna be dull after change.
 I think it is way more easier for me to read those number when it have a bright background.
 Would you guys consider make it changeable to bright color?
We're gonna make the level numbers a bright colored gradient. Should be in soon.
Will there be a way to change the size of the health-bar, or perhaps use the older one?
Can there be an option to choose between the old and the new one. I prefer the old one as it  seems smaller and more dull which I like.
Looks better, but I still don't like the shake, and I'd rather the whole bar were slightly smaller.
Keep old look but with new burst animations?

I like the gradient colours and the slightly subtler boarder around the health bar. I think for me the shake to the health bar when receiving burst damage is a bit too extreme. I think seeing somebody's health drop as much as it does, plus the fact that more attention is brought to the health bar with the gradient, means that it shaking is just a bit too much happening all at once. Plus, in teamfights when everything gets a bit hectic and you're trying to focus the vayne sat at the back or cc lock their engage in the middle of 5 of you, it would be good if the health bars were a bit more stationary, otherwise it just seems like adding a little more confusion and movement into an already hectic teamfight, which could force you to concentrate more on something you shouldn't need to, rather than on the fight.

The shaking needs to go.  For a company that toned down so many animations for the sake of cutting out visual noise in team fights, it's really surprising this is even considered.  Not only is it annoying to watch, but with everything else happening around me, I don't need that shaking as well.  Take the shaking off and you're fine.
